text.__SUMMARY__: Grevillea florida is a shrub of the genus Grevillea native to a small area in the north western Wheatbelt region of Western Australia.The erect shrub typically grows to a height of 0.9 metres (3 ft) and has non-glaucous branchlets. It has simple flat linear undissected leaves with a blade that is 10 to 45 millimetres (0.4 to 1.8 in) in length and 1 to 7 mm (0.04 to 0.28 in) wide. It blooms from August to December and produces a terminal raceme irregular inflorescence with white, cream of yellow flowers.
